meanings.definition: The state of being plump or well-rounded in figure.
meanings.sent1: Her embonpoint was the envy of all her friends.
meanings.sent2: She embraced her embonpoint and felt confident in her own skin.
meanings.sent3: At the picnic, her embonpoint made her the perfect candidate for the pie-eating contest.
meanings.sent4: The hills in the distance had an embonpoint that reminded him of her curves.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured her embonpoint in the portrait with exquisite detail.

meanings.sent1: The actress's embonpoint added charm to her character on stage.
meanings.sent2: He admired the classical sculptures depicting embonpoint figures.
meanings.sent3: The embonpoint of the snowman made it look like it had enjoyed too many snowball fights.
meanings.sent4: The embonpoint of the clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: In the painting, the artist exaggerated the embonpoint of the goddess to symbolize abundance.
